entry.title: Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite is now ready for scaled production use
entry.summary: Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite, previously in preview, is now stable and generally available. This cost-efficient model provides high quality in a small size, and includes 2.5 family features like a 1 million-token context window and multimodality. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Advanced version of Gemini with Deep Think officially achieves gold-medal standard at the International Mathematical Olympiad
entry.summary: Our advanced model officially achieved a gold-medal level performance on problems from the International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO), the world’s most prestigious competition for young mathematicians. It earned a total of 35 points by perfectly solving five out of the six problems. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Gemini 2.5: Our most intelligent models are getting even better

We’re bringing new capabilities to our models, including Deep Think, an experimental enhanced reasoning mode for 2.5 Pro. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Announcing Gemma 3n preview: Powerful, efficient, mobile-first AI
entry.summary: Gemma 3n is a cutting-edge open model designed for fast, multimodal AI on devices, featuring optimized performance, unique flexibility with a 2-in-1 model, and expanded multimodal understanding with audio, empowering developers to build live, interactive applications and sophisticated audio-centric experiences. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Images altered to trick machine vision can influence humans too
entry.summary: In a series of experiments published in Nature Communications, we found evidence that human judgments are indeed systematically influenced by adversarial perturbations. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: 2023: A Year of Groundbreaking Advances in AI and Computing
entry.summary: This has been a year of incredible progress in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) research and its practical applications. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: FunSearch: Making new discoveries in mathematical sciences using Large Language Models
entry.summary: In a paper published in Nature, we introduce FunSearch, a method for searching for “functions” written in computer code, and find new solutions in mathematics and computer science. FunSearch works by pairing a pre-trained LLM, whose goal is to provide creative solutions in the form of computer code, with an automated “evaluator”, which guards against hallucinations and incorrect ideas. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Google DeepMind at NeurIPS 2023
entry.summary: The Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS) is the largest artificial intelligence (AI) conference in the world. NeurIPS 2023 will be taking place December 10-16 in New Orleans, USA.Teams from across Google DeepMind are presenting more than 150 papers at the main conference and workshops. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Introducing Gemini: our largest and most capable AI model
entry.summary: Making AI more helpful for everyone | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Millions of new materials discovered with deep learning
entry.summary: We share the discovery of 2.2 million new crystals – equivalent to nearly 800 years’ worth of knowledge. We introduce Graph Networks for Materials Exploration (GNoME), our new deep learning tool that dramatically increases the speed and efficiency of discovery by predicting the stability of new materials. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Transforming the future of music creation
entry.summary: Announcing our most advanced music generation model and two new AI experiments, designed to open a new playground for creativity | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Empowering the next generation for an AI-enabled world
entry.summary: Experience AI's course and resources are expanding on a global scale | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: GraphCast: AI model for faster and more accurate global weather forecasting
entry.summary: We introduce GraphCast, a state-of-the-art AI model able to make medium-range weather forecasts with unprecedented accuracy | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: A glimpse of the next generation of AlphaFold
entry.summary: Progress update: Our latest AlphaFold model shows significantly improved accuracy and expands coverage beyond proteins to other biological molecules, including ligands. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Evaluating social and ethical risks from generative AI
entry.summary: Introducing a context-based framework for comprehensively evaluating the social and ethical risks of AI systems | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Scaling up learning across many different robot types
entry.summary: Robots are great specialists, but poor generalists. Typically, you have to train a model for each task, robot, and environment. Changing a single variable often requires starting from scratch. But what if we could combine the knowledge across robotics and create a way to train a general-purpose robot? | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: A catalogue of genetic mutations to help pinpoint the cause of diseases
entry.summary: New AI tool classifies the effects of 71 million ‘missense’ mutations. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Identifying AI-generated images with SynthID
entry.summary: New tool helps watermark and identify synthetic images created by Imagen | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: RT-2: New model translates vision and language into action
entry.summary: Robotic Transformer 2 (RT-2) is a novel vision-language-action (VLA) model that learns from both web and robotics data, and translates this knowledge into generalised instructions for robotic control. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Using AI to fight climate change
entry.summary: AI is a powerful technology that will transform our future, so how can we best apply it to help combat climate change and find sustainable solutions? | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Google DeepMind’s latest research at ICML 2023
entry.summary: Exploring AI safety, adaptability, and efficiency for the real world | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Developing reliable AI tools for healthcare
entry.summary: We’ve published our joint paper with Google Research in Nature Medicine, which proposes CoDoC (Complementarity-driven Deferral-to-Clinical Workflow), an AI system that learns when to rely on predictive AI tools or defer to a clinician for the most accurate interpretation of medical images. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: Exploring institutions for global AI governance
entry.summary: New white paper investigates models and functions of international institutions that could help manage opportunities and mitigate risks of advanced AI. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: RoboCat: A self-improving robotic agent
entry.summary: Robots are quickly becoming part of our everyday lives, but they’re often only programmed to perform specific tasks well. While harnessing recent advances in AI could lead to robots that could help in many more ways, progress in building general-purpose robots is slower in part because of the time needed to collect real-world training data. Our latest paper introduces a self-improving AI agent for robotics, RoboCat, that learns to perform a variety of tasks across different arms, and then self-generates new training data to improve its technique. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: YouTube: Enhancing the user experience

entry.title: DeepMind’s latest research at ICLR 2023
entry.summary: Next week marks the start of the 11th International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR), taking place 1-5 May in Kigali, Rwanda. This will be the first major artificial intelligence (AI) conference to be hosted in Africa and the first in-person event since the start of the pandemic. Researchers from around the world will gather to share their cutting-edge work in deep learning spanning the fields of AI, statistics and data science, and applications including machine vision, gaming and robotics. We’re proud to support the conference as a Diamond sponsor and DEI champion. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)

entry.title: AI for the board game Diplomacy
entry.summary: Successful communication and cooperation have been crucial for helping societies advance throughout history. The closed environments of board games can serve as a sandbox for modelling and investigating interaction and communication – and we can learn a lot from playing them. In our recent paper, published today in Nature Communications, we show how artificial agents can use communication to better cooperate in the board game Diplomacy, a vibrant domain in artificial intelligence (AI) research, known for its focus on alliance building. | Organization: Google | Source: Google Deepmind (news)
